groupSPV.controller

Class WalletController

  • java.lang.Object
    • groupSPV.controller.WalletController

  • public class WalletController
extends java.lang.Object
    Interfaces between the client and the wallet by wrapping the wallet methods.
    Author:
    Frankie Fasola, James Donnell, Spencer Escalante, Trevor Silva

    • Field Summary

      • getBalance

        public org.bitcoinj.core.Coin getBalance(org.bitcoinj.wallet.Wallet.BalanceType type)
        Returns The balance of the specified by the type passed in. The type can be left null to receive available balance of the wallet.
        Parameters:
        type - BalanceType to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The balance of the wallet.

      • sendBitcoin

        public void sendBitcoin(java.lang.String address,
                        java.lang.String amount)
                 throws org.bitcoinj.core.InsufficientMoneyException,
                        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sends Bitcoin to the specified bitcoin address.
        Parameters:
        address - String representation of the public address.
        amount - The amount of Bitcoin to send.
        Throws:
        org.bitcoinj.core.InsufficientMoneyException - Not enough money.
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - Error during execution.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Error during execution.

      • coinsRecevied

        private void coinsRecevied(org.bitcoinj.wallet.Wallet wallet,
                           org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction tx,
                           org.bitcoinj.core.Coin prevBalance,
                           org.bitcoinj.core.Coin newBalance)
        When coins are received this will report information; used as an event listener.
        Parameters:
        wallet - The wallet receiving the coins.
        tx - The transaction sending the coins.
        prevBalance - The previous balance of the wallet.
        newBalance - The new balance of the wallet.
